t: Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Where*pn is*i the certificate of your mother’s divorce, Whom*ld I have put away? Or*ld which of My creditors is*i it*i to whom I have sold you? For*ld your iniquities you have sold yourselves, And*ld for your transgressions your mother has been put away.

Why,*ld when I came, was*i there*i no man? Why,*ild when I called, was*i there*i none to answer? Is*ld My hand shortened at all that it cannot redeem? Or*ld have I no power to deliver? Indeed*ld with My rebuke I dry up the sea, I*ld make the rivers a wilderness; Their*ld fish stink because there*i is*i no water, And*ld die of thirst.
I*ld clothe the heavens with blackness, And*ld I make sackcloth their covering.”

“The*ln Lord God*s has given Me The*ld tongue of the learned, That*ld I should know how to speak A*ld word in season to him*i who*i is*i weary. He*ld awakens Me morning by morning, He*ld awakens My ear To*ld hear as the learned.
The*ld Lord God*s has opened My ear; And*ld I was not rebellious, Nor*ld did I turn away.
I*ld gave My back to those who struck Me,*i And*ld My cheeks to those who plucked out the beard; I*ld did not hide My face from shame and spitting.
“For*ln the Lord God*s will help Me; Therefore*ld I will not be disgraced; Therefore*ld I have set My face like a flint, And*ld I know that I will not be ashamed.
He*ild is*i near who justifies Me; Who*ld will contend with Me? Let*ld us stand together. Who*ld is*i My adversary? Let*ld him come near Me.
Surely*ld the Lord God*s will help Me; Who*ld is*i he who*i will condemn Me? Indeed*ld they will all grow old like a garment; The*ld moth will eat them up.
“Who*ln among you fears the Lord?*s Who*ld obeys the voice of His Servant? Who*ld walks in darkness And*ld has no light? Let*ld him trust in the name of the Lord*s And*ld rely upon his God.

Look,*ld all you who kindle a fire, Who*ld encircle yourselves*i with sparks: Walk*ld in the light of your fire and in the sparks you have kindled— This*ld you shall have from My hand: You*ld shall lie down in torment.
